ss:description.ss:name: Adder
ss:description.ss:brief: Rugged free trader designed for operation in low tech environments.
ss:description.ss:physical: A very basic design which was simple and cheap to manufacture, making it ubiquitous for its time. Limited wings provide lift during take off and re-entry.
ss:description.ss:background: Designed in the third century of the Third Imperium by Outworld Workshops at Orkney in Ilelish, the Adder was one of their first commercially successful designs. Built with redundant systems, a rugged hull which is highly forgiving of rushed repair jobs and good atmospheric capability it is highly suited for working for long periods away from good quality space ports. These days, it is often used by smugglers and traders working the edges of civilised space.
